Package Model

Class AppointmentDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.AppointmentDatabase
  • public class AppointmentDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to manage appointments in the database/application.

      • AppointmentDatabase

        public AppointmentDatabase()

    • Method Detail

      • getAppointmentList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAppointmentList()

      • getAllAppointmentsFromDatabase

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAllAppointmentsFromDatabase()
        Method used to retrieve all appointments from database. A query is executed then the ResultSet is created into Appointment objects and added to the local AppointmentList. Error messages are thrown for SQLExceptions
        Returns:
        Observable List of all Appointments

      • addAppointment

        public static void addAppointment​(Appointment appointment)

      • addAppointmentToDatabase

        public static void addAppointmentToDatabase​(Appointment appointment)
        Add appointment to Database. Appointment param is passed through and the variables are stored locally to be used in the query. Query is executed and the data is stored to the database.
        Parameters:
        appointment - Appointment to be added

      • deleteAppointment

        public static void deleteAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
        Deletes appointment used as parameter from local list if the appointment is not null. Otherwise, returns appointment not found.
        Parameters:
        appointment - Appointment to be deleted.

      • deleteAppointmentFromDatabase

        public static void deleteAppointmentFromDatabase​(Appointment appointment)
        Deletes appointment used as parameter from database. Appointment is never null because it is checked before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        appointment - Appointment to be deleted.

      • updateAppointment

        public static void updateAppointment​(int index,
                                     Appointment appointment)
        Updates appointment locally and in the database with new inputs. An appointment and its index are passed in and stored to a new appointment object. The old appointment is deleted from the local list and the new one is added. A update query is executed to add the new data to the database.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of old appointment to be deleted
        appointment - Appointment to be updated

      • searchAppointment

        public static Appointment searchAppointment​(int appointmentID)
        Search for appointment by AppointmentID A lambda is used to filter through the different appointments looking for a matching ID. Once a matching ID is found the appointment is collected to a single appointment using the toSingleObject method. Returns the appointment
        Parameters:
        appointmentID - appointmentID to be searched for
        Returns:
        Found appointment or null

      • toSingleObject

        public static <Object> java.util.stream.Collector<Object,​?,​Object> toSingleObject()
        Converts collection used in search method to a single object A collection is stored as a list and then a lambda expression is used to check the size of the list. If the list is not the size of 1 then null is returned. Otherwise, the first object is returned from the list.
        Type Parameters:
        Object - unused
        Returns:
        Object found

      • createWeekList

        public static void createWeekList()
        Creates a list of weeks that start on monday for the current year (Jan 1 - Dec 31) The first and last monday of the year including Jan 1 and DEC 31 used to create the list. This results in the first and last week including days from the previous and next year. A do-while statement is used to fill the list from start monday to end monday.

      • parseWeekForFilter

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> parseWeekForFilter()
        Week list is parsed into strings for use in Filter combo-boxes in GUI.
        Returns:
        parsed list of weeks as strings - ObservableList(String)

      • filterAppointmentsByWeek

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> filterAppointmentsByWeek​(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                                                                      java.time.LocalDate endDate)
        Method used to filter appointments by week A start and end date are used as parameters. The parameters are converted to Timestamps and compared to the appointment Timestamps.
        Parameters:
        startDate - start date of week - LocalDate
        endDate - end date of week - LocalDate
        Returns:
        list of appointments for week - ObservableList(Appointment)

      • filterAppointmentsByMonth

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> filterAppointmentsByMonth​(java.lang.String month)
        Filter appointments by month. Accepts a String of the month as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        month - String of month to filter
        Returns:
        list of appointments for month - ObservableList(Appointment)

      • createMonthList

        public static void createMonthList()
        Creates an ObservableList(String) of months. Used in month filter combo boxes in GUI

      • getMonthList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> getMonthList()

      • filterAppointmentsByDay

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> filterAppointmentsByDay​(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Filter appointments by day Used to filter tableView of Add/update appointment GUIs to allow the user to see scheduled appointments for that day
        Parameters:
        date - Selected Date to filter
        Returns:
        List of filtered appointments - ObservableList(Appointment)

      • getContactIDList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.Integer> getContactIDList()
        Retrieves a list of contact IDs from database. Used to check if the contact exists in the database.
        Returns:
        list of contact IDs - ObservableList(Integer)

      • generateAppointmentID

        public static int generateAppointmentID()
        Generates a unique appointment ID Only returns odd numbers between 0 - 1000
        Returns:
        appointmentID - int

      • convertToUTC

        public static java.sql.Timestamp convertToUTC​(java.sql.Timestamp timestamp)
        Converts a timestamp to UTC timestamp Used when timestamps are stored in database (database only in UTC)
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp
        Returns:
        timestamp converted to UTC

      • convertToLocalTime

        public static java.sql.Timestamp convertToLocalTime​(java.sql.Timestamp timestamp)
        Convert timestamp to localtime timestamp based on user default system settings Used for any displayed timestamp in GUI
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp to be converted
        Returns:
        timestamp converted to localtime - timestamp

      • convertToEST

        public static java.sql.Timestamp convertToEST​(java.sql.Timestamp timestamp)
        Convert timestamp to EST timestamp Used for appointmentDuringBusinessHours method. business hours are in EST
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp
        Returns:
        timestamp converted to EST

      • appointmentWithinFifteenMin

        public static void appointmentWithinFifteenMin()
        Method to check if an appointment starts within 15 minutes of current time Used for dashboard initialization after log-in. Displays an alert based on if an appointment is within 15 minutes or not

      • appointmentInPast

        public static java.lang.Boolean appointmentInPast​(Appointment appointment)
        Time validation method to check if an appointment is in the past. Appointments can't be scheduled in the past.
        Parameters:
        appointment - Appointment checked
        Returns:
        Boolean- true if in past, false if not

      • appointmentDuringBusinessHours

        public static java.lang.Boolean appointmentDuringBusinessHours​(java.sql.Timestamp startTimestamp,
                                                               java.sql.Timestamp endTimestamp)
        Method to check if appointment is scheduled during business hours ( 8 am - 10 pm EST every day)
        Parameters:
        startTimestamp - Appointment start timestamp
        endTimestamp - Appointment end timestamp
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if appointment during business hours, otherwise false.

      • timestampsInvalid

        public static java.lang.Boolean timestampsInvalid​(java.sql.Timestamp startTimestamp,
                                                  java.sql.Timestamp endTimestamp)
        Method to validate timestamps Displays an alert for a failed validation check
        Parameters:
        startTimestamp - appointment start timestamp
        endTimestamp - appointment end timestamp
        Returns:
        Boolean- true if invalid timestamp, false if valid

      • checkAppointmentOverlap

        public static boolean checkAppointmentOverlap​(int customerID,
                                              java.sql.Timestamp startTimestamp,
                                              java.sql.Timestamp endTimestamp)
        Check for customer appointment overlap
        Parameters:
        customerID - appointment customer id
        startTimestamp - appointment start timestamp
        endTimestamp - appointment end timestamp
        Returns:
        boolean- true if overlap

      • createReportByTypeMonth

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> createReportByTypeMonth()
        Generates a report based on amount of each unique appointment type per month Result is parsed within the ReportsController to display desired data.
        Returns:
        ObservableList(String) - String = YearMonth + type + amount

      • createScheduleForContact

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> createScheduleForContact​(int contactID)
        Creates a schedule for the contact entered as parameter Displayed in reports GUI
        Parameters:
        contactID - contactID - int
        Returns:
        ObservableList(Appointment) - list of all appointments for contact

      • createReportOnStartHour

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> createReportOnStartHour()
        Creates a report of the total amount of each appointment start hour. This report's purpose is to help business decision makers decide when to schedule additional staff to meet increased demand. The lambda is used to sort the list by starting hour, lowest - highest. Data is sorted in this manner to increase readability of barChart in reports screen.
        Returns:
        ObservableList(String) - String = startHour + amount
